channel.title: KbotPro (kosaki bot)
channel.description:
[img]http://i50.tinypic.com/s25yyb.png[/img] KBotPRO is a bot / automation tool for the MMORPG called Runescape. It can basically automate everything in Runescape dynamically as well as solving the random events for you. This includes training skills, such as mining, woodcutting, fishing and others, while also the ability to use money making scripts along with merchanting scripts.
KBotPRO is written in the programming language Java and is currently the most advanced bot for Runescape.
The bot offers multi client botting. In other words you can bot on many accounts at once. Only limited by the processing powers of your computer.
Different features we have compared to other bots: - Multi client - User friendly and nice looking user interface - Smart solutions. IE: search features. - Memory optimization features. - Multi-threading scripts are an easy task and a convenience, making it easy on the script. - EXACT model clicking separates us from our competitors, which allows for more accurate and stable scripts. - Downloads scripts from our server instead of wasting your computer space with unused scripts. - Arguably the most human-like mouse movements seen in any bot, based on gravitational formulas rather than splines, and updated in real time. - Great friendly and professional acting staff, with a great community to participate in.
The bot is scriptable and scripting to it by Java is easy to learn. The bot is ONE file, which means updating and running is simple. No need for SVN, which can be a tedious and confusing setup, for getting the most recent updates.
Our community is based on your forum username and password, which allows you to login to the bot. The bot is not open source, which keeps all of our secrets with us and will not be reproduced. This means there may be attempts to copy what we have, but will never be the same.
Images: [img]http://i49.tinypic.com/2nk8iut.png[/img] [img]http://i49.tinypic.com/2jaaz3r.jpg[/img] [img]http://boonce.org/up/epicEM.png[/img] [img]http://i50.tinypic.com/23h54zs.png[/img] [img]http://i48.tinypic.com/2qk1pur.png[/img] [img]http://i46.tinypic.com/rutzyf.png[/img]
[img]http://i46.tinypic.com/2samp1s.png[/img] [img]http://i50.tinypic.com/15e7qpz.png[/img] Setup tutorial/how to download bot: [url=http://kbot.info/vb/showthread.php?p=99361#post99361"]kbot tut[/url]

item.title: KbotPro (kosaki bot)
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:47, topic:332358”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=428793.msg3177203#msg3177203 date=1270969466]

more importantly, why doesn’t the bot run scripts with a custom securitymanager?

Tried that. Speljohan and others started screaming at me because scripts couldn’t download webpages (counters etc…) and couldn’t access the user password. Sounds like win all round.
[/quote]then permit external connections and reflection use and restrict shit like file writing?

We’ve talked about this abraham! I thought I concluded you were too stupid to continue helping anyone.[/quote][quote=“Cowie`, post:48, topic:332358”]The above post is full of fucking win.[/quote][quote=“the bank, post:50, topic:332358”]The above post is full of fucking fail.[/quote]
aha, you funny.

Read full topic

item.title: KbotPro (kosaki bot)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:53, topic:332358”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=428793.msg3179242#msg3179242 date=1271166129]

more importantly, why doesn’t the bot run scripts with a custom securitymanager?

Tried that. Speljohan and others started screaming at me because scripts couldn’t download webpages (counters etc…) and couldn’t access the user password. Sounds like win all round.

It would be trivial for those cases to pop up a window and ask the user whether the script is allowed to do X. (download a web page, access the password, etc etc) Although from personal experience writing a Security Manager is a huge pain in the ass, but you can use and modify org.moparscape.security.SecurityManager to suit your needs if you wish.
[/quote]
Oops! Google Chrome could not find cache.hybridscape.com
:([/quote]

It’s up, if you need me to I can upload it someplace else though I suppose.

Read full topic

item.title: KbotPro (kosaki bot)
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

A security manager is now controlling the scripts. That means that scripts are by default not allowed to contact servers or user Runtime.exec() Because of this some scripts may crash because of this when they really don't do anything wrong. We are building an exception system for those scripts that is confirmed to need these features. This is done for your security.

Better safe than sorry

Read full topic

item.title: KbotPro (kosaki bot)
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Silent Coder:

I have actually tried this bot, and I have to say it is pretty good. Randoms seem to be working, but I wouldn’t say it is as stable as RSBot, and it is somewhat risky because most of the scripts are unverified therefore, you do not know which one could have malicious code. People basically upload their scripts to the bot.

if you’re not a moron you would at the very least read through the code before you run it

more importantly, why doesn’t the bot run scripts with a custom securitymanager?

Read full topic
